channel.title: App-protocols on DistributedFog
channel.description: Recent content in App-protocols on DistributedFog

item.title: CoAP
item.description:
CoAP is a specialised web transfer protocol for use with constrained nodes and constrained (e.g., low-power, lossy) networks. RFC 7252 Research HTTP/2, CoAP on device HTTP/2 everywhere else, Security, Californium Cloud Services, MQTT vs CoAP, TinyOS Performance, Transport: Logistics
CoAP is network-oriented protocol with similar features to HTTP but also allows for low overhead, multicast, etc. CoAP operates over UDP (simpler) instead of TCP compensating for unreliability with a retransmission mechanism.
